name: Ngorongoro Farm House, Tanganyika Wilderness Camps

reviews.text: Four of us recently stayed at The Farmhouse as our staging area for going into the Ngorongoro Crater. We were there two nights.
reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds, Indifferent Staff, Indifferent Food

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: The best night sleep I've ever had

reviews.text: Beautiful, lush grounds. This is an active coffee plantation and the coffee trees are everywhere but they also take great effort with the rest of the area. It is beautiful!
reviews.title: Ngorongoro Farm House, Tanganyika Wilderness Camps

reviews.text: Large, relatively pleasant rooms. I was very pleasantly surprised with the rooms as to size and view. In the back of the room are large windows/patio doors that looked over the coffee trees and the valley and hills beyond. Not all rooms have this view. The rooms are a duplex arrangement of buildings spread over a large area.
reviews.title: Fun at the crater

reviews.text: Plentiful food. Meals are served as a buffet and there is plenty of it. At breakfast there is a omelet station, which is nice.
reviews.title: Delightful and peaceful night

reviews.text: What a beautiful resort and wonderful place to unwind after a long day safariing! The staff immediately welcomed us with a delightful cool drink upon arrival. (Don't fear-- the two German Shepherd dogs are friendly!) Our family's connecting rooms, which overlooked the vast farm (which serving also as a long path for running in solitude) were roomy and comfy with the option of use of the fireplace for a small charge - great shower, mattress, towels etc. The grounds were absolutely stunning including the pool and coffee plantation. The food was excellent served buffet style but the boxed lunch, which was provided for our afternoon safari, was disappointing. Overall I would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Retreat and Relax

reviews.text: This is a really beautiful accommodation option that is within easy distance to the entrance of Ngorongoro Conservation Area. The rooms are spread throughout the property, which is a working farm, so it can be quite a walk from the room to the restaurant, however this is a non issue as the paths are well lit and the scenery from the paths of the farm are really beautiful (it could be a bit more problematic if it were raining). The rooms themselves are huge with lovely high ceilings and a really nice décor. The staff were really helpful. Late on my first evening there I discovered by shower didn't work. They were quick to attend to the problem and moved me to another room with no fuss when fixing the shower proved impossible. The food is simple but very fresh and tasty. I highly recommend it as a place to stay.
reviews.title: A Very Nice Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Peaceful lodge within reasonable distance from Ngorongoro Crater where we stayed 1 night as a part of our safari tour. The rooms were a very good standard, spacious and had many comforts, ours was particularly secluded being at the far end of the plot which suited us very well as we were offered fantastic views across fields and a mountain from our veranda. The only issue with the room was there were a large number of dead wasps around the window sills and curtains, we weren't normally fussed with bugs etc but these had been fumagated and were slightly unpleasant. We mentioned to the staff at dinner but I think they were too busy to clean it as no action was taken, however this certainly didn't spoil our stay.
reviews.title: Nice secluded lodge close to Ngorongoro Crater

reviews.text: The buffet dinner was very good and the wine selection was well priced, the restaurant was set in a very lovely building with a large outdoor patio area to sit out in after. We very much enjoyed our stay here and am sure those who are heading there will not be dissapointed.
reviews.title: Lovely property

reviews.text: Our room seemed to be one of the closest and I'd guess it was still at least 1/4 mile or more from the main lodge area. The rooms themselves are duplexes and depending on your neighbors, can be noisy. There are high ceilings and everything echoes but the wall between the bathroom and the rest of the room doesn't go all the way up, so be prepared to share with everyone in the room and possibly next door. :)
reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bedrooms are huge, bathrooms smaller, nice showers, and superb front terrace with view over the coffee plantation. Some rooms are rather a long way from the main lodge. Grounds, being a real farm, are quite beautiful. Not a big fan of buffet meals, but they were well laid out, good food, hot was hot, and cold was cold. Prices for drinks from the bar was reasonable considering where you are. Wait staff was very friendly. Sadly, in May it's cold and damp. We could not get things to dry in the shower as we usually do, but a little sun on the terrace fixed that. It was cool and damp at night and we could not figure out why until we realized that some of the windows behind curtains do not actually close, so the night air was coming in all the time. In the hotter weather, this would probably be a good thing. Yes, there is a fireplace in the room, but you have to pay for the wood service, and we're kind of stingy. The nightly entertainment on the spacious main lodge deck was local Masaai, and probably would have been better without trying to include untalented guests. It served as accoms for visits to local national parks, and for that it was great.
reviews.title: Season does make a difference

reviews.text: I was on a group tour and we only stayed here one night, but the room was very nice, comfy and cozy. It had a fireplace which we didn't need, but it would have been fun to be there when you could have used it! I liked that the cottages were secluded and away from the main lodge area. Dinner was a buffet and the food was really good and very plentiful. We had some local entertainment before dinner which was fun. Lovely views from the main lodge and the landscaping was beautiful throughout. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Lovely Setting and Comfy accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights at the Ngorongoro Farmhouse on 19 and 20 May 2013. We were really looking forward to the stay and were massively disappointed and pleased to leave.
reviews.title: What A Massive Disappointment

reviews.text: The buildings themselves are stunning, the roooms are spacious but everything is spoilt by insufficient staff (I know it is low season but that didn't affect other places we stayed in Tanzania) and a general feeling that the staff who were on duty didn't seem to care about their clientele.
reviews.title: Great place to re-energise

reviews.text: The food was average and served as a buffet style. I have no problem with buffet but I do have a problem when the Farmhouse is advertised as ".. a small and exclusive lodge". It was nothing of the sort. It was cold, impersonal and had no facilities - even the internet was only available in a small room and you had to use the Farmhouse computers to access the internet - every other place we stayed offered wifi in some way.
reviews.title: It couldn't get better

reviews.text: This place is set in the most beautiful and well kept ground. We had a suite which was very big and spacious, with a huge bathroom, and big veranda with great views. Although the bed which was very big, was quite hard.
reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds
AMAZING
reviews.text: This is quite a big establishment so you don't get the personal feel that you do from smaller lodges you find on safari. Staff are friendly and very keen to be helpful, however, (as we found everywhere during our safari and stay in Zanzibar) things tended to get lost in translation, therefore patients is needed.
The buffet dinner was disappointing, as was the music during dinner (far to international, with no choice of local dishes, or local music)
reviews.title: A "WOW" Place!

reviews.text: One thing to note, our stay was during the winter and the room suite was very cold.
reviews.title: LOVE IT!

reviews.text: Absolutely loved it here. Only stayed one night, wish we had stayed longer as people friendly, beautiful grounds, spacious rooms and friendly staff. Swimming pool was lovely too. Would definitely go back!
reviews.title: Amazing!!

description: Ngorongoro – KaratuLodge. Ngorongoro Farm House is a 500 acre coffee farm nestle in a beautiful woodland area and located 4 km from the Lolduare entrance to the Ngorongoro Conservation Area.48 cottage rooms and 3 suite rooms built in 3 intimate camps.The Lodge has eco-friendly electric power supplied by solar panels, with a generator as a back-up.Nearest airstrip: Lake Manyara Airstrip 40 min away.Activities: Guided walks in the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, guided walk around the coffee plantation followed by a coffee bean roasting demonstration. Visits to local villages and schools or swim in the pool. At any time guests may enjoy a relaxing massage.
